channel.title: Error With Initiating Player Class
channel.description:
Okay when I try initiate the Player class in my PacketBuilder class it says that Player is abstract and cannot be instanced. I was wondering how I cauld assign Player to somthing to stop this or how to get around this so I can initiate Player in PacketHandler. This is what I mean by initiating: [code] Player plr = null; plr = new Player(); [/code]
If anyone cauld help me with this it would be a life saver because if I don't initiate Player it will just keep returning NullPointerExceptions.
Thankyou.
~Zandia

item.title: Error With Initiating Player Class
item.dc:creator: @Zandia Zandia
item.description:
@Zandia wrote:

Okay when I try initiate the Player class in my PacketBuilder class it says that Player is abstract and cannot be instanced.
I was wondering how I cauld assign Player to somthing to stop this or how to get around this so I can initiate Player in
PacketHandler. This is what I mean by initiating:

Player plr = null;
plr = new Player();

If anyone cauld help me with this it would be a life saver because if I don’t initiate Player it will just keep returning NullPointerExceptions.

Thankyou.

~Zandia
